abstract.p: Minamoto Kitchoan, Japanese confectionary shop in Manhattan, offers variety of pastel fruit-based items, most alluring of which are made from white peaches; photo (M)

block.p: Just walking into Minamoto Kitchoan, the Japanese confectionary shop at 608 Fifth Avenue (entrance on 49th Street), is a cooling experience. The display cases brim with pastel fruit-based items, the most alluring of which are made from white peaches.

Just walking into Minamoto Kitchoan, the Japanese confectionary shop at 608 Fifth Avenue (entrance on 49th Street), is a cooling experience. The display cases brim with pastel fruit-based items, the most alluring of which are made from white peaches.

One is a frozen white peach sorbet-like drink, beautifully packaged in a small plastic container with a straw ($4.80), a delightful, delicately sweetened and highly perfumed refresher to sip as it thaws. Another is a kind of aspic ($10), shaped like a blushing peach half, which can be frozen to a sorbet consistency. It can be eaten with a spoon or cut into wedges to decorate a fruit plate. Smaller squares of the lush jelly are sold in a box for $3.50.
